hints.content:
Numbers are equivalent when they represent the same place on the number line.

Let's compare each point to $\blueD{\dfrac26}$ and find the equivalent fraction.

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into 6 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The bottom rectangle shows one whole divided into 4 equal parts. One part is shaded. A number line below the rectangles shows tick marks from zero-sixths to six-sixths above the number line and zero-fourths to four-fourths below the number line. A green point appears at the tick mark one-fourth. A blue point appears at the tick mark two-sixths. The blue point is to the right of the green point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into 6 equal parts. Two parts are shaded. The bottom rectangle shows one whole divided into 8 equal parts. Four parts are shaded. A number line below the rectangles show tick marks from zero-sixths to six-sixths above the number line and zero-eighths to eight-eighths below the number line. A blue point appears at the tick mark two-sixths. A purple point appears at the tick mark for four-eighths. The purple point is to the right of the blue point. !

Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle shows one whole divided into 6 parts. Two parts are shaded. The bottom rectangle shows one whole divided into 3 parts. One part is shaded. A number line below the rectangles show tick marks from zero-sixths to six-sixths above the number line and zero-thirds to three-thirds below the number line. A pink and blue point appears at tick mark two-sixths which is the same as tick mark one-third. !

hints.content: $\maroonD{L}$ is in the same place on the number line as $\blueD{\dfrac26}$.

The following number line is equivalent to $\dfrac{2}{6}$.



[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, Point L, an unlabeled tick mark, and an ending tick mark at 1. !

question.content:
**Which number line shows a number equivalent to $\dfrac{2}{6}$? **

[[☃ radio 2]]

choices.content: ![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, Point L, an unlabeled tick mark, and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/03007bec0dee565bc3ee7abaa02fc2e4da326ced)

![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, Point M, two unlabeled tick marks, and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2a75467ff03894862846ba5b06f7626cf589d12d)

![A number line that has moving left to right, a starting tick mark at 0, three unlabeled tick marks, Point N, three unlabeled tick marks and an ending tick mark at 1.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/30bde7d44211495c0372026435b76dea935f2da7)
